tha-ap153:0.3_0: Hearing his livelihood, held together by senior monks.
tha-ap153:1.3_0: and has finished with relishing and greed
tha-ap153:1.4_0: he has crossed over clinging to the world.
tha-ap153:2.2_0: Among the best of three things:
tha-ap153:3.3_0: I bowed down to the Buddha,
tha-ap153:4.1_0: The lie down on the same sheet
tha-ap153:4.3_0: I’m not aware of any bad places
tha-ap153:5.1_0: Seven from here, seven from there—
tha-ap153:5.3_0: The supreme eye is not easily,
tha-ap153:6.1_0: Attaining the four kinds of textual analysis
tha-ap153:6.2_0: and skeleton without flesh or blood,
tha-ap153:6.3_0: I have realized the six kinds of direct knowledge,
tha-ap153:7.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Bandhumatī.
tha-ap153:8.1_0: Bandhumatī and the senior of a senior monks.
